section.title: Configuring the Force Model
section.para: Propagation in GMAT is governed by a force model and an integrator, which together form a propagator. The force model component offers many options that let you control the fidelity of the simulation, from a simple two-body model with a single point mass to a full-featured model with central body non-spherical gravity, external point masses, atmospheric drag, and more. This example configures an Earth-centered model with some commonly-used parameters. Starting from the default mission:

step.para: In the Resources tree, double-click DefaultProp to open its properties window.
Under Gravity, in the Degree box, type 21.
In the Order box, type 21.
In the Atmosphere Model list, click MSISE90.
Next to the PointMasses box, click the Select button.
In the Available Bodies list on the left, click Sun, then click -> to add Sun to your force model.
Add Luna (Earth's moon) and Jupiter using the same steps as above.
Click OK to accept your changes.
Select Use Solar Radiation Pressure to activate the solar radiation pressure force.
Click OK to accept your changes.

section.para: The script for the force model configured above is shown below.
section.programlisting: Create ForceModel DefaultProp_ForceModel DefaultProp_ForceModel.CentralBody = Earth DefaultProp_ForceModel.PrimaryBodies = {Earth} DefaultProp_ForceModel.PointMasses = {Jupiter, Luna, Sun} DefaultProp_ForceModel.SRP = On DefaultProp_ForceModel.GravityField.Earth.Degree = 21 DefaultProp_ForceModel.GravityField.Earth.Order = 21 DefaultProp_ForceModel.GravityField.Earth.PotentialFile = 'JGM2.cof' DefaultProp_ForceModel.Drag.AtmosphereModel = MSISE90

section.title: Configuring the Force Model: Mars
section.para: Creating a high-fidelity propagator for Mars is a bit more complex than for Earth or the Moon. GMAT does not by default include Phobos and Deimos as celestial bodies, so these must be added manually to include them in the force model. This example shows how to do this, starting from the default mission.

This example requires an external ephemeris file for Mars' moons. For the following steps to work, download this file from this link: ftp://naif.jpl.nasa.gov/pub/naif/generic_kernels/spk/satellites/mar097.bsp .
First, create Phobos as a Moon resource:

step.para: In the Resource tree, expand the SolarSystem folder to display all default celestial bodies.
Right-click Mars, point to Add, and click Moon.
Type Phobos and click OK.
Double-click the new Phobos resource to edit its properties.
Set the following properties to the values shown. These are actual values for Phobos:
Click the Orbit tab.
In the Ephemeris Source list, make sure SPICE is selected. This is currently the only available option.
In the NAIF ID box, type 401. This is the international identification number for Phobos.
Click the Add button and choose the file mar085.bsp that you downloaded above.
Click OK to accept these changes.

section.para: Now follow the same steps to add Deimos. The only differences are the following values:

step.para: In the Resources tree, in the Propagators folder, double-click DefaultProp to edit its properties.
In the Central Body list, click Mars.
In the Primary Body list, click Mars.
Under Gravity, in the Model list, click Mars-50C.
In the Degree and Order boxes, type 4 and 4, respectively.
Next to the Point Masses box, click Select.
In the Available Bodies list, click Jupiter, Sun, Phobos, and Deimos, and click the right arrow to transfer them to the Selected Bodies list.
Click OK to accept this list.
Check Use Solar Radiation Pressure to enable this force.
Click OK to accept these changes.

section.para: The script for the resources configured above is shown below.
section.programlisting:
Create Moon Phobos Phobos.NAIFId = 401 Phobos.OrbitSpiceKernelName = {'C:\mar097.bsp'} Phobos.EquatorialRadius = 13.5 Phobos.Flattening = 0.318 Phobos.Mu = 0.00070934 Phobos.PosVelSource = 'SPICE' Phobos.CentralBody = 'Mars'
Create Moon Deimos Deimos.NAIFId = 402 Deimos.OrbitSpiceKernelName = {'C:\mar097.bsp'} Deimos.EquatorialRadius = 7.5 Deimos.Flattening = 0.31 Deimos.Mu = 0.000158817 Deimos.PosVelSource = 'SPICE' Deimos.CentralBody = 'Mars'
Create ForceModel DefaultProp_ForceModel DefaultProp_ForceModel.CentralBody = Mars DefaultProp_ForceModel.PrimaryBodies = {Mars} DefaultProp_ForceModel.PointMasses = {Deimos, Jupiter, Phobos, Sun} DefaultProp_ForceModel.SRP = On DefaultProp_ForceModel.GravityField.Mars.Degree = 4 DefaultProp_ForceModel.GravityField.Mars.Order = 4 DefaultProp_ForceModel.GravityField.Mars.PotentialFile = 'Mars50c.cof'

section.title: Propagating for a Duration
section.para: GMAT can propagate a spacecraft for a duration of time, such as 60 seconds, 10 days, or one orbit period. Starting from the default mission:

step.para: Click the Mission tab to show the Mission tree.
Double-click Propagate1. The default mission is configured to propagate the DefaultSC spacecraft for 12000 seconds.
In the Parameter column, to the left of DefaultSC.ElapsedSecs, click …. This will display a window allowing you to choose a new type of duration parameter.
In the Object Properties list, click ElapsedDays, then click -> to add it to the Selected Value(s) list.
Click OK.
In the Condition column, double-click the value 0.0 and enter 10 instead.

section.para: GMAT will propagate the spacecraft for 10 days. Observe the 2D and 3D plots showing the propagated orbit.

section.title: Propagating to an Orbit Condition
section.para: GMAT can propagate a spacecraft to a specific orbit condition, such as periapsis, an altitude value, or a latitude value. Starting from the default mission:

step.para: Click the Mission tab to show the Mission tree.
Double-click Propagate1. The default mission is configured to propagate the DefaultSC spacecraft for 12000 seconds.
In the Parameter column, to the left of DefaultSC.ElapsedSecs, click …. This will display a window allowing you to choose a new type of duration parameter.
In the Object Properties list, click Periapsis.
In the Central Body list, make sure Earth is selected. Then click -> to add it to the Selected Value(s) list.
Click OK to close the ParameterSelectDialog window.

section.para: GMAT will propagate the spacecraft until it reaches orbit periapsis.
